Laundromat

Laundry delivery service for people on the go.

Overview

Laundromat is a business idea exploring pickup and drop off laundry service. Users of the service are able to request the service through an app and enter up to 3 locations for pickup and drop-off of their laundry. The target audience is young adults and predominantly male.

The client requires a universal and clean look, exuding a feeling of competence and speediness. However, they do not want the association of colour green associated with their environment-friendly business because it is overused and a bit too cliché.

Historical Research

The original Laundromat concept was founded by Harry Greenwald in the 1940s. He was inspired by the his lunch visits to Horn & Hardart's Automat in New York, a restaurant that served food in boxes with glass doors. Customers would enter a coin in a slot to open the glass doors.

The Art Deco typography, signage and architecture of the 1940s in general conveyed a sense of speed and modernism. Some stylistic traits of Art Deco in design included strong geometric shapes and bold colours.

The characteristics of this style aligned with client's visual preferences, therefore I chose to expand on the Art Deco style from my 3 logo compositions.

Logo Designs

Web and Mobile Comps

Following the Art Deco motif, the prototypes uses angled lines, geometric shapes and a royal blue monochromatic colour scheme.

Summary

  1. Historical research on a business can uncover valuable design ideas. In this case, I was fortunate to apply my historical research to the design.
  2. Diagonal lines can be a challenge for developers when it comes to coding the site.
  3. Do not diverge too much from aesthetics and colour palette you originally planned or consistency can be lost.
  4. Be thorough and try not to skip design processes, otherwise you will eventually have to go back to them.
Neybrly Moveo Laundromat SPEC
